instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2533: What is 820-2533? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP1V05_S5: What is PP1V05_S5? PP1V05_S5 is a 1.05v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. On 2008-2009 15” and 17” Macbook boards, this often gets stuck at 0.3v due to a bad C7771 capacitor. .
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green Light No Fan Spin
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> present ??? Voltage in <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S5</SIGNAL> ?? If you have something other than 1.05V, replace <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> .... You should also use power pads (<RESISTOR>R5014</RESISTOR> or <RESISTOR>R5015</RESISTOR>) to power on the board, it does not power on by itself ...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green Light No Fan Spin
threads.message: Power button must be pressed to power on. Are you using a REAL APPLE 85W charger? Tried with a known good charged battery?
